Speaker: seventh draft
Dialogue: 3 FEBRUARY 1999

Speaker: miss hudlapp
Dialogue: CLASS!  How many times have I told you? In this class we do not pound tenpenny nails into Stanley's head!

Speaker: miss hudlapp
Dialogue: Young man. What's that in your lap?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Oooo-oo-ooh, baby. I love your way.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: How about it, Doc? Can you help me?

Speaker: shrink
Dialogue: Not overnight. These imaginary monkey cases take time. I vould estimate...roughly...

Speaker: shrink
Dialogue: Twelve years and three months ought to do it.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: One question, doc - what did you mean when you said "imaginary"?

Speaker: shrink
Dialogue: All in good time, my boy. All in good time.

Speaker: shrink
Dialogue: Vot a crackpot! Monkey on ze back - HAH!! ROLL OUT ZE WACKY WAGON!!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Aw, Monkeybone! At this rate I'll never find a good shrink.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Those guys are a waste of money! I'll show you how to stop sucking your thumb...

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Thank you...that's our pilot...the good news is, Comedy Channel has just picked us up with an order for six new episodes!

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Now, let's give it up for the guy who started it all. Creator of America's most disturbed comic strip...the man behind the monkey...Mister Stu Miley!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I don't actually draw all the animation, no. We have sweatshop workers who couldn't get jobs at Nike doing that.

Speaker: beautiful fan
Dialogue: Mr. Miley, would you draw Monkeybone on my belly? As a guide?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Guide...?

Speaker: beautiful fan
Dialogue: For my tattoo artist?

Speaker: beautiful fan
Dialogue: Wait! You have to draw the rest of him -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I - I have to, uh, check in with my doctor. DO- OCCCC!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hey, Doc. Come here. There's something really cool I want to show you.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: See these doors? The cool thing is, you go out ...they close...you can't get back in!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: You want to leave? But Stu - you're a big hit! Everyone loves you!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: They don't love me. They love Monkeybone.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: It was you who got the standing O. It was you drawing on the belly over there...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: That was especially Monkeybone. Come on, Doc, I don't want to be stuck here with this bunch of media creeps. I just want to be us. Home. Alone!  I have something I have to give you.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Can't you give it to me later?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Yeah, I could, but the thing is, if later got here sooner, it would be...better.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Sorry, Julie - won't be a minute. Now Stu - I know you don't like the idea, but you really ought to talk to these guys -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Julie and I - we were just gonna go...

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Go? There's a potload of money here, pal. You got three major toy companies...you got the guys from Burger God over here...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Burger God. The ones that found the pig hair in the french fries?

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Never proven. They're ready to pop for a pre- emptive endorsement. Kids love Burger God -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Herb, it's too much. It's all out of hand.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Do you know what kind of opportunity you have here? You gotta strike. I'm talking mansions. Lamborghinis. Champagne for mouthwash when you brush your teeth!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I don't want to be rich. It's just a trap!

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Being rich is not a trap. That is a dirty lie perpetuated by rich people to keep the failures from killing them.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Herb. I have to go.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I got the ring.  Tonight's the night, Herb. Tonight's the night.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Oh my God...you're proposing?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: My life was totally crappy, Herb, and she... fixed it. She made me happy. Which I'd never been. She loves me the way I am - right now.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: ...In some weird way I respect that.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Okay then. If I get you out of here - you pop the question - tonight. Or else. Get me?

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: They're just prototypes...take 'em home and look at 'em before you say no...  If you could just hold on a minute or two, we're expecting a couple more trucks.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Okay, okay! You're a beautiful couple. Go.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Look at this! He won't let us leave!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: The monkey!! He's everywhere! He'll take over both our lives if we let him.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu - stop it. That monkey is good luck. You thought him up, and everybody loves him, and he's probably going to make you rich. So relax! Enjoy it!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'm trying. It's weird, that's all. I never had any good luck, until I met you...what if it's all just another bad dream?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What's the "bad" part?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I might wake up.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I am happy. It just so happens this is the happiest night of my life.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: That damn monkey is everywh--

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Did we just - hit something?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Are you okay??

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hey! Are you guys all right in there?

Speaker: teenage girl
Dialogue: We're fine.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: That stupid monkey banner! It fell on my windshield - it practically killed us all!  God, Julie, if anything had happened to you -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'm fine, baby. We're all okay. We were lucky.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'd better go report this...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Dad's car?

Speaker: teenage girl
Dialogue: What was that? Did you hear that?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: STU!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Operator? I want to report an accident.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu? I'm here, baby. It's me. It's Julie. I love you. You're gonna be okay, baby, I promise -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hello? Anybody? - Am I dead?  PLEASE. I'D LIKE TO KNOW IF I'M DEAD.

Speaker: snake
Dialogue: Cigars, mister? Genuine Coobans!

Speaker: rabbit
Dialogue: Wanna meet my sister?

Speaker: singing sphinxes
Dialogue: Weeee...welcome you to Dark Town And while you're in your coma This odd amusement park-town Will be your Home Sweet Homa -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Help me. Please. There's animals. They -

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Pony ride, Mister?

Speaker: joe camel
Dialogue: Hey, Mister. Mister! Got a smoke?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Chasing me - animals - horrible -

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Animals? What kind of animals?

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Yeah, I know - Picasso. Guernica, right? That's what everybody says - although personally, I don't see the resemblance. What are you drinking?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Uhh - martini?

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Olive or eyeball?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Olive. - Where exactly am I?

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Dark Town. Land of nightmares. I'm Bull.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Stu Miley.

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Yeah, I've seen a few of your dreams. You're quite a celebrity down here.

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: I told you, it's the land of nightmares. Same on every channel...all the stuff people dream, after they have the extra anchovies.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Jeez, it all looks like bad late-night cable.

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Sad commentary, huh?

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: I beg your pardon?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I didn't say anything.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I was, uh, just getting ready to leave...

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Yo, Jumbo. We got us some kind of ventriloquist here.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Just kiddin', folks! Drinks for everybody -

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Just a spike, ma'am. It happens. It's perfectly natural with coma patients.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'm a doctor too. I know this man's brain -

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Go home, Doctor. Rest. Come back when you can do us some good.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Julie?

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Now don't pick a fight. I'm staying over.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh, poor Buster. He hasn't been fed in a day and a half. Let me get some food...

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Special occasion?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I don't know. I guess it was...

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Don't get all poignant. We're keeping this bottle on ice. When he comes around you're going to need it.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Who did this?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu. That was right about the time we met.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: When he first came in to the sleep lab?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Yeah...before your time.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Jesus, honey...he always joked about you curing him, but I never realized what you cured him from.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: He hadn't gotten a good night's sleep in years. The nightmares would wake him up, and he'd start right in painting...

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: How do you get from here - to there?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Switch hands.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'm serious. It was bicameral disjunction - right brain and left brain out of balance. He was a rightie, so I made him switch the pencil to his left hand. Just to see what'd come out.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Monkeybone?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Left-handed, he was funny. He'd been doing all this scary, intense work...then he found out he could draw this stuff, and make me laugh, and he liked that.  And then the nightmares just...stopped.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Wow - two guys in the same brain. - Which one did you fall in love with?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I've put a ton of work into that boy, Alice. I am not going to let him get away from me.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Kimmy...?

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Oh, Julie...my poor Stu...my poor baby brother...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: When'd you get in?

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: An hour ago.  I tried to prepare myself, but I didn't know he would be like, like this. I can't even bear to look at him... How about you? You're okay?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'm fine, Kimmy. Fine.

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: I had so much I always wanted to say to him. At least he had a chance to give you the ring.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: The ring...

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Grandmama's ring. The engagement ring. He asked me to send it to him -

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Can you give us a realistic sense of my brother's chances?

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: But these...machines are what's keeping him alive, is that right?

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Can you give me a realistic idea...of how long this is going to last?

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Honey, I have to clarify this. The thing is, Dr. Edelstein, my brother has an absolute horror of doctors - hospitals - needles - all of it -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Kimmy, he doesn't know what's going on. He doesn't even know he's in a -

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Please, Julie. This is not easy for me. Our father took a long time to die. A long time. It just about killed us all. And Stu and I made a pact that when our time came - we wouldn't let it drag out.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: It's too soon even to - talk about that!

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: Give me a date, Doctor.

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: I want him to have every chance, Doctor. We can certainly give it...three months.

Speaker: emcee
Dialogue: And now the last of our five finalists...Miss Michigan...GEORGE T. WILLOUGHBY!

Speaker: emcee
Dialogue: And now George will give us his analysis of Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle as it pertains to third-world economics!!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I'm gonna wash that man right outta my hair!

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Hey, Stu, why so glum? Everybody loves a good humiliation nightmare.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Three months, Bull. Three months tonight. Three months since the accident - and I'm no closer to going home than I was then.

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Aw, buck up. Have another 'tini.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'm sick of martinis. I'm sick of the waiting, and the carnival rides, and watching people's nightmares. And of course, I need not add -

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Thank you, thank you for that very modest

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: We've got a special dedication tonight. This one's from my ever-lovin' boss, Mr. Stu Mopey - I mean Miley - and we're sendin' it up to a very special lady in the land of the living. Yes, I do mean Julie - the beautiful Miss Julie - who, if she has a brain in her head, is shacked up right now with some good-lookin' doc she met in the E.R.!  JUST KIDDING, BUDDY! Because if we know anything about Miss Julie, we know she is faithful, loyal, and true. Even if her boyfriend is an eggplant. Which is why we're dedicating...this very special tune...to her. Jumbo?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: MAH baby does the Hanky-Panky! UNHH! MAH baby does the Hanky-Panky! UNHH!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You have humiliated me in public for the last

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I doubt that. Besides, I can't help myself. I'm just a figment of your imagination.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Then you can learn to act normally. I had to!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Aw, come on. You know you love me. You're a masochistic pain freak. You gotta love me.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I am not. And I don't gotta.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: You are too! Mooning over Julie when we could both be gettin' some o' this fine local action. It's not like she's gonna know. Out of town, under five minutes, and in a coma don't count.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Sorry. The women here aren't my type. Most of them aren't even my species.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Hellooooooooo, Kitty.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Hiya, Stu. Refill on that martini?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I'd like something with an umbrella in it and a really smutty name. Like a...Sex Behind the Sofa with Your Parents in the Same Room Watching "The Brady Bunch."

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Nothing for him! He's being repressed.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Is something wrong, Stu? You seem so tense.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Aaah, it's the same as always...poor mope's just wishin' he was me.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I've been trying to get through to the head guy - the nightmare god - what's his name?

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Hypnos?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Yeah. To see if he could expedite my case. But I wait, and I wait, and...I'm starting to think I'll never see her again.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I shoulda proposed, Kitty. That way at least she'd know how I feel. That way she'd...wait for me.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: She is waiting for you, Stu. I know she is. Guys like you don't come along that often. Believe me, I know.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: My Fellow Americans. I have a dream. Let us boldly go where no man has gone before.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: I mean it, Stu. You're one in a million.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'm not so special. I'm just - kind of -

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Come on, pal! It was a compliment! You'da done the same if you had the equipment!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: THAT DOES IT! BACK IN THE PACK!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: FORGET IT! NO WAY! I'M NOT GETTING -

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I'm reportin' this to my union!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: What union?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: The sidekicks' union! Me, Tonto, and Robin the Boy Wonder. You top bananas better watch your ass!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: DIVE! DIVE!!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I left my phone number in your undies. Try not to lose it in traffic.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Sorry, Kitty! I'll be right back after I choke my monkey.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Him. Whew. About time!

Speaker: reaper
Dialogue: EARL BIEGLER. I'VE COME -

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: Can't hear you, young fellow. Speak up!

Speaker: reaper
Dialogue: EARL BIEGLER, I'VE COME TO GIVE YOU - aw, hell. Here.

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: An E-Ticket!

Speaker: patron
Dialogue: He got a reprieve.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Good for him! He's gonna wake up!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: No. No. Not him.

Speaker: earl
Dialogue: So long, suckers! See you in the funny papers!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: He's ninety. He's practically dead already. How come he goes back and I stay here?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Maybe he wanted to pick out his own casket?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: HEY!! HEY, YOU!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: He got an E-ticket. Where's mine? When do I get

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu? Stu? Let's not disturb the nice Reaper.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I've been stuck down here for months. Somebody had better start paying attention, or I'm gonna - I'm gonna kick ass!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Let's not kick the nice Reaper's ass.

Speaker: reaper
Dialogue: SORRY, BUD. OFF-DUTY.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu? Stu? Let's calm down, talk things over. How about some comedy relief? Okay. Brontosaurus walks into a gay bar...

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu? Stu? I think weve got this backwards. Your behavior...is disturbing me.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: That's right. Run! And don't come back unless you've got my e-ticket!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Who am I kidding? I'm never gonna get out of here. I'll never see her again.

Speaker: messenger boy
Dialogue: Miley? Stu Miley?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hypnos! The god of nightmares! Do you know what this means, Monkeybone? He's finally going to hear my case. I'm going home!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I think we can go another day without shaving. Long as you don't look like you're growing one of those stupid little goatees.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Hey, there's an article about the Monkeybone show. They've run that one episode about eight times now. Herb says it gets higher ratings every time...they're hoping you'll give 'em some new material soon...  Wanna hear another joke?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Okay...let me see...here we go. A plane full of explorers crashlands in New Guinea; they are captured by a cannibal tribe and taken to the chief's hut, where...wait a minute. I know this one...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Okay. Let's try again. Why did the pervert cross the road?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Kimmy! What's the matter?

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: This is hard for me, Julie...very hard...but it's been three months now, and...  I gave the order.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Now this...is livin'.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Y'call that art? Why, my three-year-old can paint better than that.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Like you'd know. You started out on the back of a napkin, you little...doodle.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Hey! Like the do. So tell me, are you a, uhh... natural snakehead?

Speaker: gorgon
Dialogue: Only fifty dollars to find out.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Fifty dollars?! Bite me!

Speaker: gorgon
Dialogue: You got it, big boy.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Say, have you seen Mr. Hypnos?

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: Hyp? He was here a while ago. Aren't you Stu Miley? The nightmare guy?

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: I heard you were going to be here tonight. This is so cool!

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: You fat slob! Watch what you're doing!

Speaker: jumbo
Dialogue: Why don't you slap me? Go on, slap me!

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: Come on, Stu. Let's go where the real fun is.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Wow. Live feed, huh?

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: You bet. Hyp gets all the best stuff before it goes out to the theatres.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: Shh! There's a new one just starting.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: That - that's me.

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: Nice shirt, dude!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: What is this? Who's dreaming this??  Julie??

Speaker: yeti
Dialogue: Hey, keep it down!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: JULIE!!

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: Stu!! What are you doing? Chill out!!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: No. No. STU!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: JULIE! I'M HERE, DOC! DON'T LET THEM PULL THE PLUG! I'M HERE!!!

Speaker: cyclops
Dialogue: HEY! Watch it, you stinkin' gringo -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: JULIE! I'M HERE! I LOVE YOU!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu? STU...?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: STU!!!!

Speaker: jumbo
Dialogue: Who invited this schmuck, anyway?

Speaker: hand woman
Dialogue: Oh, it's my fault. I thought he was cooler than that.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Listen. Please. It's my girlfriend. I've gotta get a message to her...

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: HYP!!!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I knew I left it in there somewhere.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Haw! I like a monkey with vision!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: You said it, partner!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: How'd you get in there?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu... It's a party.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Mr. Hypnos - sir - I needed to talk to you -

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Wait a minute. Stu Miley, right? Boys and girls ...Mr. Stu Miley, in the house!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Mr. Hypnos, I saw a dream. My girlfriend was having it. She dreamed they were pulling the plug on me. She was watching me die.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Uh huh. And?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Well, I have to get a message to her. I have to let her know I'm okay. Until I can get out of here...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: ...which is actually what I wanted to talk to you about. See, I've been here three months -

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Kid - didn't they tell you about this party?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Tell me what?

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: It's a special kind of party. A farewell party. Do you...get what I'm saying?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Farewell? You mean - you mean I'm -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'M GOING HOME! I'M WAKING UP! HEY, EVERYBODY! I'M OUTTA HERE. I...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I think I...I'm about to... Am I mistaken, or don't I get to... Is there some...

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Y'see, Stu, as I understand it, you made this pact with your sister...no life support?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Pact? Pact? NO LIFE SUPPORT??

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Well - yeah - but that doesn't...apply. It was different then. I was depressed. My life is great now. I'm in love!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Pull the plug! Pull the plug! Take my organs! I don't need 'em! I don't need no! Life support! I'm an idiot! Pull the pl--

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Besides, Julie wouldn't...she'd never...

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Actually, Stu, Julie doesn't get to decide. That's why she was having the nightmare.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Nine AM! But that's - twelve hours.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I'm so dumb! I deserve to die -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Mr. Hypnos, you run this place. I'm begging you. There's gotta be something I can do.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Stu, I like you personally, I admire your work, but I'm just the God of Sleep. This is Death's bailiwick.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Maybe you could talk to Death!

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Me? Me, go crawling to Death? My friend, it will be a cold, cold day in Las Vegas, Nevada, before I go crawling to that piece of -

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Now Death is not what you would call a people person, like me. Death is a putz - and I should know. I'm his little brother.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You're Death's brother?

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Oh yeah. Mr. By-the-book, Stick-Up-the-Ass, My- Way-or-the-Highway Death. Believe me - over the course of eternity, you get pretty damned tired of that schtick.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: The penthouse is pretty swank, though.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Thank you. I decorated it myself.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Guys, I don't mean to be rude, but I only have eleven hours and fifty-three minutes to...

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Oh, right. Cheating Death. There's one thing you might try. Only one guy in history ever pulled it off. Well, actually two. Actually, no, there was that other guy who...well, very few people have done it.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hyp, I'll do anything.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Me too. And I mean anything. Ask the chicks in the back room.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: You've seen those E-tickets, right? Well, what you gotta do...is go into the Land of Death... and steal an E-ticket right out from under Death's nose.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Land of Death. How do I get there?

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Kid, listen: that's all I'm saying. And you didn't hear it from me.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: You've heard of a fate worse than Death? That's what's waiting for you if you screw up.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Fate worse than death! Well, it's been real, boss, but I gotta go buff up my resum. ANYBODY HERE NEED A FIGMENT?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Fine! Don't put yourself out. I'll go to the land of Death alone.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu, you have my absolute confidence. - DEAD MAN! DEAD MAN WALKING!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I've got one chance to get back to Julie, and I'm gonna take it - with or without you.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Hey. Aren't you gonna talk me into it?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: No. Goodbye. Thanks for nothing.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: You gotta talk me into it. You'll screw up on your own. I mean, a guy's gotta have a sidekick. For moral support! Wisecracks - snappy banter -  It's the land of Death, Stu, the Land of Death! Don't go in there without your comedy relief!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: All right. You can come.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: OH, THANK YOU! THANK YOU! TH--  Something went very, very wrong here.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Now we just gotta figure out how to get there.

Speaker: reaper
Dialogue: LULU LA RUE. I HAVE COME FOR YOU.

Speaker: reaper
Dialogue: LULU LA RUE, I HAVE COME FOR -

Speaker: lulu
Dialogue: Shay, you're kinda cute.

Speaker: fred
Dialogue: Say there. How 'bout one for the road?

Speaker: fred
Dialogue: Hold this for me, pally.

Speaker: fred
Dialogue: Ooopsy daisy.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Is that what they call "death with dignity"?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Two words for you, my friend: club soda.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: He's taking her to the land of Death, right? So all we've gotta do is...hitch a ride!  Stop shaking! I'll protect you.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Oh, sure. Mr. Action Hero! Why couldn't I be Arnold Schwarzenegger's figment?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Where'd he go??

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Six hours. That's when they pull the plug. That's how long we've got to wake him up.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: ...they show incredibly intense nightmare activity. The chart below is his new chart...

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: Holy shit.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: He's stuck in a loop - a nightmare loop.  Anybody here know what Oneirix is?

Speaker: clarissa
Dialogue: Sure - it's an enzyme. The brain secretes it during violent dream activity...

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: It's nightmare juice. Julie and I were on the team that learned to synthesize it. If those charts are right, Stu's swimming in the stuff.  Are you thinking we can decrease the levels?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: No. I want to give him more. I want to give him a massive dose.

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: That's not going to stop his nightmare -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I don't want to stop the nightmare, Hutch. I want to crank it up. I want to take it right off the charts. I want to scare him awake.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: All right! We have a plan. Let's move!

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: You know, Julie, even if this works - which it probably won't - that stuff is tricky. You don't know what it'll do to his brain.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What'll it do if they pull the plug?

Speaker: reaper
Dialogue: Batch of souls - just back from Processing.

Speaker: death's assistant
Dialogue: Put them over there with the others.

Speaker: death's assistant
Dialogue: Your Grimness? We have a new shipment -

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Last Days of Pompeii...now there was a Great Moment in Death.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: I can't believe - oh, man, I - SINATRA!! Do you know how long I've been waiting for this?

Speaker: death's assistant
Dialogue: Make that 12:07, your bleakness...the dispatch team is waiting...

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Okay, okay, send 'em in. Jeez.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Chakasandra Singh, New Delhi. Snakebite.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Mulrooney, Lavinia P., Dearborn, Michigan. Head crushed in a pants press.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: YOU!!!

Speaker: death
Dialogue: You're the customer, okay? You're about to die. It's a big occasion. A formal occasion. And as you shuffle off this mortal coil, the last thing your eyes behold is a Grim Reaper covered with...  What the hell is that??

Speaker: death
Dialogue: ...What??

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Well - whatever it is - you get that shroud to the dry cleaner ASAP! Now where were we?

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Clarke P. Devereaux, San Francisco. Complications resulting from coma...

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Oh, wait. Says here he's supposed to recover.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Take this to Dark Town. Sad to say, he's gonna live another forty years.  Sorry. Nobody said this job would be easy.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Say, Death, just out of curiosity, could we maybe swap jobs with that other guy? See, we've been meaning to drop in on Dark Town - I mean I've been meaning to...

Speaker: death
Dialogue: ...I beg your pardon?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: I got relatives there. I...EEP!!

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Now what were you saying?

Speaker: death
Dialogue: I'd like to have a word with you in private.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: IMPOSTORS!! GET 'EM!!

Speaker: death
Dialogue: HYPNOS! That little twerp! He's the one who put you up to this!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Yowie.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Head. HEAD!!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu...Stu...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: IT'S NOT WORKING.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: There's a thing here! There's a switch!

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Stu...LOOK!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Isn't that Lulu?

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Now we've got 'em.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Weren't we just here?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: What'd I tell you? You go to the Land of Death, wear a jockstrap!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What's the maximum safe dose?

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Most we've ever used is half a CC.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Five CC's.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: This ain't my nightmare!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You saved my life, Monkeybone. I never would've made it without you.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Move it. We got exactly five minutes left.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: It's just...now that I'm leaving, I feel like there's lots of things I haven't said. Who's gonna look out for you? Are you gonna be okay when I'm gone?

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Oh, don't you worry. I'll be fine.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You've been a hell of a figment, pal. I sure wish I could take you home with me.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Awwww. Worried about my feelings, are you? Well, there's a new twist.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Don't joke around, little buddy. I mean it. I really do love y--

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Love you too. Boss.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Stop! Monkeybone! Please!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: NO! DON'T YOU UNDERSTAND?? HE'S GOT MY E-TICKET! HE'S GOT MY -

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Sorry, Stu. It's all part of the deal. We've got big plans for that body of yours!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: NO! JULIE! NO-O-O-O!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: EEEEEEPP!!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Oooie! That smarts!!!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Julie?... Hey, you are a looker.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: It's a miracle. It's a miracle.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Two more ticks of the clock...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Thank you. Thank you for coming back to me.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Who are y-- WHAT DO YOU WANT??

Speaker: genghis khan
Dialogue: Dinner.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Alfred Hitchcock??

Speaker: typhoid mary
Dialogue: That's how he keeps his girlish figure.

Speaker: stephen king
Dialogue: Gotta move fast in this crowd, or you'll starve. Here you go, pal. Have some popcorn.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: What is this stuff?

Speaker: stephen king
Dialogue: They feed us the slops from the Morpheum Theatre. You hope for Jujubes, settle for goobers. - I'm Steve. Steve King.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Stephen King? What are you doing in here?

Speaker: typhoid mary
Dialogue: Typhoid Mary.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Atilla the - ! What in hell is this place?

Speaker: rat guard
Dialogue: All hail the most glorious! Most eminent! Most esteemed all-powerful God of Sleep...his Royal Lassitude -

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Enough, enough, I'm hung over.

Speaker: typhoid mary
Dialogue: Hyp! Did you bring me the cough medicine?

Speaker: stephen king
Dialogue: Did you remember the night light I asked for?

Speaker: stephen king
Dialogue: Bite me, Poe! I hate waking up in the dark.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Sorry, Steve, maybe next time. And how's our new guest settling in - ?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: YOU SET ME UP!!

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Easy, pal! I was coming to congratulate you. It ain't easy snatching one of those E-tickets. Steve here was the last guy to pull it off, and that musta been, what, 25 years ago...?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Why'd you do it? What'd I ever do to you?!?

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: It's simple, Stu. We need nightmares - lots of 'em. So whenever we can swing it, we send a guy up to stimulate the flow...a nightmare maker! Like Steve here. Poe. Rasputin...we've been doing this all the way back to Atilla and Genghis Khan!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: But why me? Why'd you pick on me??

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: The monkey, of course. It was his idea.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Monkeybone...!?

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Nobody wants to be a sidekick, Stu. So one day he comes to us - he's got a proposition. We help him get your body...in return he gives us all the nightmares we want.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You're nuts! I'm a comic strip artist! What's he gonna do - draw really scary cartoons??

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Oh, no, no, no. Y'see, Stu, as it happens, that girlfriend of yours figured out the chemical basis of bad dreams. And she just whipped up a big old batch of nightmare juice!

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Oh, we're predicting a record box-office. It's like I always say...nightmares are your best entertainment!

Speaker: kimmy
Dialogue: I just couldn't stand the thought of you suffering. I love you so, I would never have... forgive me, Stu. Please forgive me.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Welcome home.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh, baby, I can't believe you're back.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Baby? Why don't you just...rest on the sofa for a minute. I'll be right back.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Here's to a bottle...we should have opened... three months ago.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu, are you...feeling okay?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: You're acting kind of...odd.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Buster! Look who's here!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What are you watching?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: You sure this is...medically advisable?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Well. As long as it's okay with Monkeybone -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh, God!! Baby! Are you -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: How was it? I don't recall.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: It was great, baby. Let's get you to the ER.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'm not like the rest of you. I'm just a regular guy! I'm not a "nightmare maker."

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Neither are we. We got our bodies hijacked just like you. The guys who replaced us are the nightmare makers!

Speaker: attila
Dialogue: Like me. I was a mess sergeant in the Mongol Horde. I never wanted to be the Scourge of Asia. I just wanted a new recipe for yak!

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: But how? Did you all have sidekicks? Figments? ...Monkeys??

Speaker: stephen king
Dialogue: Hey, I got screwed over by my own dog. Go through hell to get that E-ticket, and who winds up in my body? That darn Cujo.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: He's sure got a thing for those icy blondes.

Speaker: rat guard
Dialogue: Miley. You got a visitor.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: ...Kitty?!?

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: I'm so sorry, Stu. I wanted to tell you what was going on. I really, really liked you.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Kitty...my situation is really not important. The thing is, my girlfriend is now living with, and possibly engaged to, a demented monkey.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: You're such a beautiful man. Look at you - stuck in this place, and only thinking of her.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Listen to me! Is there any way I can warn her what Monkeybone is up to??

Speaker: rat guard
Dialogue: Time's up! Break it up, you two.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: No! Give me a moment. Just to look at him. Oh, Stu. Oh, my sweet, sweet Stu.

Speaker: rat guard
Dialogue: Feeding time!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'm heading in to work, baby. Are you sure you'll be okay?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: They only made the one episode. They've shown it about nineteen times.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I had to park two blocks away. Is something -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I took the liberty of calling a little press conference. We're on TV, so don't say "shit."  Shit! I said it. Shit! I said it again!

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: Stu, what is it about Monkeybone that makes him so popular?

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: I tell you, he's ready to merchandise. We've gotta move quickly. Get the toy guys, the burger guys, the lunchbox guys -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Herb...what in God's name -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What's this about merchandising? You always hated merchandising!

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: You two-bit simian stooge. WHAT THE HELL IS THIS? We didn't send you up here to shake your booty and chase broads. We sent you up to make nightmares!!

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Now find that nightmare juice and get to work. 'Cause you may be a free man during the day... but when you dream, your monkey ass is mine!

Speaker: female baboon
Dialogue: Hey, handsome.

Speaker: female baboon
Dialogue: Yeah, you. Come here, good-looking.  Why don't you let me out of this cage?

Speaker: female baboon
Dialogue: I know how to be very, very grateful.

Speaker: janitor
Dialogue: Gettin' jiggy wit' it - gettin' jiggy wit' it...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu? Is that you? Where did you go?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Baby, don't lie. I know you went out.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: You're wearing a topcoat, Stu. - Where are your pants?

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Less.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Oh, here's something. The city zoo is kicking off a fund-raising campaign. They wonder if you'd be willing to appear at a benefit.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Well, nothing. It's a benefit. But we could probably get People and Entertainment Tonight to cover it.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: And last...you remember Bill here, from the Bazoom Toy Company? He's got a little something I think you'll like.

Speaker: bazoom exec
Dialogue: Well - I guess...

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: So here's my idea. We do a giveaway at the zoo benefit. We get a big piata. We fill it with Monkeybone dolls - hundreds of 'em.

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: A piata. That's a great idea!

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: Head trauma.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: It's his world - we just live in it. Monkeybone! Back with six all-new episodes, starting -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: The thing is, I'm responsible for the way he's acting. It's the nightmare juice. It's got to be.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Julie, that stuff probably saved his life.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I can't explain this, Alice, but I'm not so sure it did. It's as if...he's not Stu any more. The Stu I love is gone!

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Listen. Let's bring him in for some tests. I guarantee you're overreacting.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Actually, no, I don't think I'm overreacting.

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Dog dreams!! That stinkin' monkey. I can't believe it. We give him a body, and he sends us ...dogs.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Let's not think about dogs. Let's think about pussycats. Meeowwwwwwrrrr....

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Shh! You'll need it when you're traveling.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Don't ask where I got it.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You can't do this! You'll get in trouble!

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: You're the only true-hearted man I ever met. You find a way back to that girl of yours and make her happy.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: How am I gonna get past the guards?

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: I'll worry about the guards.

Speaker: kitty
Dialogue: Go. Just go.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Thanks, Kitty, I'll never forget you for th--

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'll really...never...forget you.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: "4/17: Subject, when unaware of observation, prefers to hold eating utensils...with feet. Successfully carves turkey roll holding eating utensils...with feet."

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: They had a case like that at Johns Hopkins. Wires got crossed between hands and feet.

Speaker: clarissa
Dialogue: Great lead. I'll try and find it on the net.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: "4/18: Subject climbs backyard tree...to perform elimination. When confronted with product... blames it on family dog."

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: Seems perfectly obvious. He's been possessed by a monkey!

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: You're really gonna pop the question?

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: I can't believe you. You used to hate being the center of attention. Now you're proposing, in public, at a benefit.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Hello? Oh, Hutch - what?

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: The Nightmare Juice! It's gone! Somebody switched it for a beaker of grape Kool-Aid!!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Kool-Aid!? But who'd would want to -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Okay. Call the police. I'll be right over.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: The technical name is Oneirix. It's an enzyme. It's present in the brains of -

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah...Nightmare juice.

Speaker: detective ii
Dialogue: And there's been no sign of a break-in?

Speaker: hutch
Dialogue: Holy shit...the pants.  The janitor found a pair of torn-up pants. It was the same night the monkey tipped her cage over. Remember that, Julie?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Yeah...I remember it vividly.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Now, if I may ask - what kind of idiot sneaks into the Land of Death twice?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: You're mad at me. Great. You have every right to be. But we're both mad at Dark Town. We're both mad at Hypnos.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Oh, sure. Now you're gonna tell me it was all his idea. You were completely innocent -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I'm not going to tell you that. I wanted that E- ticket. I wanted it so bad I'd stare you right in the face to get it - and I'd do the same again.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Why??

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: I have a girl up there. And I never - I should've - I just want to tell her I love her.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: I'm a simple man. I'm just doing my job. I enjoy

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Death, I'm trying to make things right. Take my soul. Turn me into a paper doll. But give me just one lousy hour.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Well - you'd need a body.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: If it wasn't for that comic strip of yours, I wouldn't be doing this. But a good chuckle is darned hard to come by.  That one where Monkeybone stole the soap cake out of the urinal - I thought I would die.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Coming from you, that's quite a compliment.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: De nada. Now, come here...bend over...before I change my mind.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Bend over?

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: Okay...detaching the left kidney...

Speaker: organ donor
Dialogue: What the - who the hell am I??

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: You're an organ donor!

Speaker: organ donor
Dialogue: Am I dead?!?

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: The chute didn't open. We kind of assumed -

Speaker: organ donor
Dialogue: I need this body. Just for a few minutes. I'll bring it back, okay?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Might have someone take a look at that.

Speaker: lead surgeon
Dialogue: I think it can still be saved. Put it on ice.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Whatever he's done, I'm responsible for it.

Speaker: clarissa
Dialogue: That's not true, Julie. It's not true.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: This is not about your guilt, Julie. There could be innocent people in danger.

Speaker: clarissa
Dialogue: He's not the same guy. He's not your Stu.  I didn't want to tell you this, but the other day he pinched me on the butt.

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: I didn't want to tell you this, but the other day he tried to mount me from behind! Look, you have to tell the police.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Tell them what? I don't know anything concrete. All I have is a feeling.

Speaker: clarissa
Dialogue: Oh my God, we've got a flasher.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: That...that's Herb!

Speaker: herb
Dialogue: CLOTHES! Beware of clothes. They're working together. All of them. Shirts...pants... ENSEMBLES...!

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: IT'S HIM! HE'S GETTING OFF!

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: Did you see a corpse running this way?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: It looks so...new.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: But the heirloom ring. Your grandmother's ring...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: He called me "Doc."

Speaker: guest
Dialogue: HEY MONKEYBONE!!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Please. Where did you take that man...?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Who are you? Why did you say those things?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: BUSTER?!?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stu...how?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: alice
Dialogue: Detective, please let this man out of the van.

Speaker: organizer
Dialogue: I don't understand, officer. This is a benefit. Surely this can wait until -

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Sorry, ma'am...we need to question Mr. Miley on a most urgent matter.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Stop this. Now. Those dolls have been tampered with. They're toxic!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Ma'am, can you give me some idea of what's going on here?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: HE'S GETTING AWAY!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: STU!!

Speaker: head surgeon
Dialogue: LOOK! IT'S HIM!

Speaker: head surgeon
Dialogue: Put it on ice. I think it can still be saved!

Speaker: head surgeon
Dialogue: Put it on ice. I think it can still be saved.

Speaker: head surgeon
Dialogue: Put him on ice. I think he can still be saved!

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Not again. THAT STINKING MONKEY!!!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: I think I can bring 'em down.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: DEATH!!

Speaker: death
Dialogue: I dress up when I want to make an impression. - So how'd it go?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Fine, thanks. Saw my girl, said goodbye, everything's gonna be okay.  I guess I'm yours now.

Speaker: monkeybone
Dialogue: Death, I'd like to point out that none of this was my fault. The roots of this tragedy go back to a callous, uncaring society that -

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Hey. Where's Monkeybone?

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Back in your head, where he belongs.  No offense, Stu, but on your own you're kinda vanilla. I didn't want to send you back without him.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Back? You're sending me back?

Speaker: death
Dialogue: It's irregular, but...I just love that strip of yours. I figure I'll take the "Family Circus" guy instead.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Death! Thank you!

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Thank me next time you see me.

Speaker: death
Dialogue: Ohhhh, Hypnos??

Speaker: hypnos
Dialogue: Death! So nice to see you. I can explain -

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I don't know what happened. All I know is...he was in a coma...and then he came back...and now he's gone again.

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: Excuse me. We lost a corpse - we saw him heading this way...

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: I got a couple of fresh ones in the back. Help yourself.

Speaker: surgeon
Dialogue: I'll be. It's him all right. Still dead...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Is it you? Is it really you this time?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh, Stu. Tell me I'm not dreaming.

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: Baby...you're asking the wrong guy.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Speaker: stu
Dialogue: My tail itches.
